analysis: The documents in this cluster primarily concern the establishment, modification, or transfer of functions and responsibilities within the Executive Branch of the U.S. government. They often involve the creation of committees, councils, or offices to address specific issues, coordinate activities, or provide advice to the President. Many documents also deal with the transfer of authority, personnel, and resources between different agencies or departments. The documents reflect efforts to improve efficiency, address emerging challenges, and implement policy goals across various sectors, including national security, economic development, environmental protection, and social welfare.
title: Executive Branch Reorganization and Coordination
